active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the consequences of a broken chain of custody in a cybersecurity incident response scenario involving physical media transfer (e.g., a hard drive from a compromised site). Identify at least three preventive measures and justify their priority based on risk to asset integrity.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Asset Security (Domain: Information and Asset Handling, Subdomain: Media Handling and Protection > Media Transfer and Transportation > Chain of Custody for Media). Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Information and Asset Handling > Media Handling and Protection > Media Transfer and Transportation > Chain of Custody for Media. Incorporate this research context: Chain of Custody (CoC) tracks media assets (e.g., USBs, HDDs) via documentation (who/what/when/where/why/how) to ensure integrity/accountability. Broken CoC risks tampering. Standards: NIST SP 800-88 (sanitization), SP 800-53 (audit protection), CISA Insights (CoC for CI), ISO 27001 A.8.3, CIS v8 Control 4. Sources: cisa.gov/insights_chain-of-custody-and-ci-systems_508.pdf. Use these exact learning objectives (Bloom's progression), active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema provided below. Prioritize voter consensus: pedagogy (Bloom's, scaffolding), completeness (NIST/standards, examples like USB handoffs). [INSERT FULL LEARNING_OBJECTIVES, ACTIVE_LEARNING, SCAFFOLDING, FLASHCARD_SCHEMA HERE AS TEXT] Generate 25 high-quality flashcards covering all objectives (at least 1 per), layers (balanced), and card types. Ensure university pedagogy: active recall, spaced repetition friendly, higher-order thinking. Tie to real-world (e.g., investigations). Output ONLY in JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': {... or null}, 'tags': [...]}}]. No extra text.
